title: [Community Permissions] Backend

labels.name: priority F2: important
labels.description: a feature the app should have if possible, has high business value but the app can work without it

milestone.description:
Priorities **in priority order** for the 0.13 milestone:

**0. Performance & Memory usage**

- Further improve CPU & Memory usage
- Make app more responsive and snappy

**1. Finish items started in 0.12**
- Complete any outstanding issues related to pairing (for syncing) - Igor
- Implement the 'Admin' role (issue #10114) - Mykhailo
- 'Featured' category curation via curation dApp - Patryk
- Any remaining work to pay off tech. debt related to mutual contacts - Mishka
- When creating/editing token based permission, ability to search for and selecting Collectables from OpenSea - MichaelC

**2. Channel token permissions**
- Create, edit and delete channel token permissions in the permissions admin screens
- This includes the "no tokens required to view this channel" permission
- All user facing channel token permissions functionality e.g. what happens when a user tries to access a token gated channel they don't have the required tokens to access, what happens when a user only has permissions to view a channel, etc...
- If a community is an open (not token gated at the community level) community, if a channel is token gated AND if **no** "no tokens required to view this channel" permission for that channel exists, then the channel should be automatically encrypted.  If token gating is removed from a channel, the channel should become unencrypted.
- Asset (ERC-20) minting and airdropping functionality - GravityBlast

**3. Add some type of cache in front of sqlite to ensure that writes don't block reads (Patryk?)**
- It has been discovered that one of the causes of sometimes slow channel switching is that writes to sqlite block reads, and this is the cause of slow channel switching in many cases
- Investigate the feasibility of (and if feasible implement) a general purpose cache for sqlite writes, which caches sqlite writes and then only writes them to sqlite in small chunks when no read operations are taking place (so that read operations are always prioritized, and not interrupted by writes).  Such a cache should cache all or almost all write requests from all areas of status-go

**_OR_**

- Perhaps it's time to bite the bullet and start the work needed to migrate both Status Desktop and Status Mobile from using sqlite to using PostgreSQL?

**_OR_**

- Perhaps there are some other possible solutions to this issue that should be explored before embarking on either of these large items?

**4. Update app to use new 'Share URL' formats**
- add functionality to status-go to generate the new 'Share URL' formats for sharing links to: User Profiles, Communities, Channel inside a Community
- Update everywhere a user can share a URL from to use the new URL format
- Ability to share a URL that points to a specific channel in a community (issue #10160)
- Update all address inputs to accept a user pasting a 'share URL' into the input (in addition to being able to input the raw address).  This includes: Start new chat input, send contact request input in Settings, the import community key input, etc...
- Update Status Desktops URL handler so that if Status is installed on a computer, when a user clicks on a Status 'Share URL' the app is launched (if not already running) and after signing in the user is automatically taken to the entity the Share URL represented inside the app.  e.g. if a user clicks on a URL for a Status Community, the user should be taken to the home screen for that community inside the Status App

**5. Profile showcase backend***

**6. Fix bugs, bugs and more bugs!**
- The 0.13 release is targeted to be Status Desktop's first "beta" release, and the first release of Status Desktop that will be used by people outside of the Status Org.  So we want this release to be the best possible quality so it makes a good first impression  



**--- For the Wallet team ---**

1. Complete any outstanding development related to the activity screens
2. New settings screens
3. Fix 'backup from waku' bugs
4. Fix keycard bugs
5. Implement 'imported key and account' syncing and transfer between devices
6. Transaction signing dialogue (if designs are ready)

body:
### Description

EPIC https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/5981 is almost done, so **UI part for community permissions** is ready and now working with _mocked data._

Here a high level list of backend needs ([figma design](https://www.figma.com/file/17fc13UBFvInrLgNUKJJg5/Kuba%E2%8E%9CDesktop?node-id=2992%3A367890&t=MvpCZX7pPOMCYkn8-0)):

#### General:
- [x] Define / create new NIM module that contains a **permissions list object model** and make it a visible module for the UI. Use the `AppLayout/Chat/stores/CommunitiesStore.qml` as a base file to understand which are the model roles the UI is expecting (in `createPermission` a mock permissions object is created).
- [x] API method to validate a permission before it is created to cover the following use case (agree with design team which are the expected validation rules): https://www.figma.com/file/17fc13UBFvInrLgNUKJJg5/Kuba%E2%8E%9CDesktop?node-id=22253%3A486103&t=2kdi9XnmFFXnsQfU-0
- [x] API method to create a new permission 
- [ ] API method to duplicate a permission
- [x] API method to remove a permission
- [x] API method to edit an existing permission
- [ ] API method to determine the % of community members that fulfill the requirements to cover the following use case: https://www.figma.com/file/17fc13UBFvInrLgNUKJJg5/Kuba%E2%8E%9CDesktop?node-id=22772%3A496682&t=Q7sGGTFUmcOTI1oq-0

#### Holdings
- [x] API method/object model to get `Community collectible / tokens` and `Listed collectibles / tokens` dropdown data. 
https://www.figma.com/file/17fc13UBFvInrLgNUKJJg5/Kuba%E2%8E%9CDesktop?node-id=2934%3A482819&t=2kdi9XnmFFXnsQfU-0
https://www.figma.com/file/17fc13UBFvInrLgNUKJJg5/Kuba%E2%8E%9CDesktop?node-id=2934%3A484524&t=k9Rsiro7S7LLW2to-0
- [ ]  API method to get following filtering options for collectibles:  `most viewed`, `newest first` and `oldest first`.
https://www.figma.com/file/17fc13UBFvInrLgNUKJJg5/Kuba%E2%8E%9CDesktop?node-id=2934%3A484608&t=YvTezgDekHc7O9d8-0
- [ ]  API method to get ENS custom subdomain validation
https://www.figma.com/file/17fc13UBFvInrLgNUKJJg5/Kuba%E2%8E%9CDesktop?node-id=15471%3A461262&t=2kdi9XnmFFXnsQfU-0
- [x] Do the integration of getting the real data (assets and collectibles in the user's wallet) to be displayed in the corresponding holdings dropdown lists.

#### Permissions (is alowed to):
- [ ] API method/object model to get the list of possible permissions (now hardcoded in ui)
https://www.figma.com/file/17fc13UBFvInrLgNUKJJg5/Kuba%E2%8E%9CDesktop?node-id=2934%3A481728&t=2kdi9XnmFFXnsQfU-0

#### Permissions management
- [ ] How this permissions will be applied?

>  API method to duplicate a permission

@noeliaSD AFAIK duplicating will be removed, right?

> > API method to duplicate a permission
> 
> @noeliaSD AFAIK duplicating will be removed, right?

Yes! The design flow changed so now, when user clicks on `duplicate` it navigates to the "create new permission" page and the call to the backend will be the regular one done when a new permission is created!
Closing as it is outdated and stuff is tracked elsewhere
